5.0.0-beta.6.name: @wdio/logger
5.0.0-beta.6.description: A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages
5.0.0-beta.6.readme:
WDIO Logger Utility
===================

> A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages

This package is used across all WebdriverIO packages to log information using the [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package. It can also be used for any other arbitrary Node.js project.

## Install

To install the package just call

```sh
$ npm install @wdio/logger
```

or when adding it to a WebdriverIO subpackage:

```sh
$ lerna add @wdio/logger --scope <subpackage>
```

## Usage

The package exposes a logger function that you can use to register an instance for your scoped package:

```js
import logger from '@wdio/logger'

const log = logger('myPackage')
log.info('some logs')
```

For more info see [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package on NPM.

5.0.0-beta.16.name: @wdio/logger
5.0.0-beta.16.description: A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages
5.0.0-beta.16.readme:
WDIO Logger Utility
===================

> A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages

This package is used across all WebdriverIO packages to log information using the [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package. It can also be used for any other arbitrary Node.js project.

## Install

To install the package just call

```sh
$ npm install @wdio/logger
```

or when adding it to a WebdriverIO subpackage:

```sh
$ lerna add @wdio/logger --scope <subpackage>
```

## Usage

The package exposes a logger function that you can use to register an instance for your scoped package:

```js
import logger from '@wdio/logger'

const log = logger('myPackage')
log.info('some logs')
```

For more info see [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package on NPM.

6.0.0-alpha.0.name: @wdio/logger
6.0.0-alpha.0.description: A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages
6.0.0-alpha.0.readme:
WDIO Logger Utility
===================

> A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages

This package is used across all WebdriverIO packages to log information using the [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package. It can also be used for any other arbitrary Node.js project.

## Install

To install the package just call

```sh
$ npm install @wdio/logger
```

or when adding it to a WebdriverIO subpackage:

```sh
$ lerna add @wdio/logger --scope <subpackage>
```

## Usage

The package exposes a logger function that you can use to register an instance for your scoped package:

```js
import logger from '@wdio/logger'

const log = logger('myPackage')
log.info('some logs')
```

For more info see [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package on NPM.

7.0.0-beta.0.name: @wdio/logger
7.0.0-beta.0.description: A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages
7.0.0-beta.0.readme:
WDIO Logger Utility
===================

> A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages

This package is used across all WebdriverIO packages to log information using the [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package. It can also be used for any other arbitrary Node.js project.

## Install

To install the package just call

```sh
$ npm install @wdio/logger
```

or when adding it to a WebdriverIO subpackage:

```sh
$ lerna add @wdio/logger --scope <subpackage>
```

## Usage

The package exposes a logger function that you can use to register an instance for your scoped package:

```js
import logger from '@wdio/logger'

const log = logger('myPackage')
log.info('some logs')
```

For more info see [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package on NPM.

8.0.0-alpha.213.readme:
WDIO Logger Utility
===================

> A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages

This package is used across all WebdriverIO packages to log information using the [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package. It can also be used for any other arbitrary Node.js project.

## Install

To install the package just call

```sh
npm install @wdio/logger
```

or when adding it to a WebdriverIO subpackage:

```sh
lerna add @wdio/logger --scope <subpackage>
```

## Usage

The package exposes a logger function that you can use to register an instance for your scoped package:

```js
import logger from '@wdio/logger'

const log = logger('myPackage')
log.info('some logs')
```

For more info see [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package on NPM.

```sh
npm install @wdio/logger
```

```sh
lerna add @wdio/logger --scope <subpackage>
```

## Usage

The package exposes a logger function that you can use to register an instance for your scoped package:

```js
import logger from '@wdio/logger'

const log = logger('myPackage')
log.info('some logs')
```

For more info see [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package on NPM.

8.0.0-alpha.507.name: @wdio/logger
8.0.0-alpha.507.description: A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages
8.0.0-alpha.507.readme:
WDIO Logger Utility
===================

> A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages

This package is used across all WebdriverIO packages to log information using the [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package. It can also be used for any other arbitrary Node.js project.

## Install

To install the package just call

```sh
npm install @wdio/logger
```

or when adding it to a WebdriverIO subpackage:

```sh
lerna add @wdio/logger --scope <subpackage>
```

## Usage

The package exposes a logger function that you can use to register an instance for your scoped package:

```js
import logger from '@wdio/logger'

const log = logger('myPackage')
log.info('some logs')
```

For more info see [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package on NPM.

8.0.0-alpha.563.name: @wdio/logger
8.0.0-alpha.563.description: A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages
8.0.0-alpha.563.readme:
WDIO Logger Utility
===================

> A helper utility for logging of WebdriverIO packages

This package is used across all WebdriverIO packages to log information using the [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package. It can also be used for any other arbitrary Node.js project.

## Install

To install the package just call

```sh
npm install @wdio/logger
```

or when adding it to a WebdriverIO subpackage:

```sh
lerna add @wdio/logger --scope <subpackage>
```

## Usage

The package exposes a logger function that you can use to register an instance for your scoped package:

```js
import logger from '@wdio/logger'

const log = logger('myPackage')
log.info('some logs')
```

For more info see [`loglevel`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loglevel) package on NPM.
